Mastery (IAPSOP) About Archives Practices Contribute Contacts Search     Periodical: Mastery Summary:  From Pat Deveney's database: Mastery. A Monthly Magazine Devoted to the Living of the New Life. 1914--1915 Monthly, bimonthly Isleworth, London, England. Publisher: New Life Center. Editor: Orlando Edgar Miller. Succeeds: Temple of Health Idea Succeeded by: Chapala Round Table; Psychological Review of Reviews 1/1, August 1914-October 1915. 48 pp., 5s. a year. This was a product of the New Life Centre / New Education University Centre in London, a New Thought venture of Orlando Edgar Miller and Paul Tyner. The Centre featured regular services on Sundays, with talks by the principals. The journal was very high-toned and intellectual in its approach and seems not to have prospered. Contributions by a host of minor English New Thought figures and by Mabel Gifford Shine, Ella Wheeler Wilcox, and others. In addition to the Centre, Miller had a Healing Home business and the Miller Institute, a New Thought sanitarium -- and probably house of assignation. Miller was in Wormwood Scrubs for manslaughter from October 1914 to January 1915, during which interlude the journal was probably edited by Paul Tyner, a frequent contributor. On Miller and his exploits, see the notes under Psychological Review of Reviews and Chapala Round Table. NYPL; University of Cambridge.
